channel.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
channel.description:
First Born - Blue Dragon Special
Passive 1: Personal guard - Night immune once. You keep this passive if converted. Passive 2: Pure Blood - You can step up to be king. If you become king You will have the abilitys of the starting King
Night Ability: Loyal - If someone tries to convert you it will fail. They will think it succeeded (2 uses)
Heir - Unknown Special(converted First born for both cult and unseen)
Passive 1: Monitored - You do not meet with the other evils and you don't know who they are. You do not count towards the maximum unseen. Passive 2: Pure blood - You can step up to be king. If you become king You will have the abilitys of the starting King
Day Ability: Clear mind - Appear as the First born to investigative classes tomorrow (3 uses)
Night Ability: Ally's: Check to see if your target is the same faction as you (Unlimited)
Now for the starting king suggestion worthy of his Specialness. Everything but the night Ability's is the same
Night Ability 1: Defend! - Give someone night Immunity. Does not consume a use if they are not attacked. Can target self. (2 uses)
Night Ability 2: Recruit! - If your target is convertable and not unique they will learn your faction and be converted depending on your faction. Does not consume a use if it fails. Evils are all not convertable. (1 use)
BD convert - Knight with convert Immunity Neutral King - Merc auto contracted to you with convert Immunity Unseen/Cult - Advisor
Advisor - Unknown Special (Is unseen/cult depending on what is in the game) Passive 1: Knowledgeable - You are immune to attacks from the Unseen/Cult Passive 2: Direct line - You have a night chat with the king as long as he is evil
Day Ability: Signal - The king will know who you signaled
Night Ability: Inspect - learn If the target is evil

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
I just fail to see the point in a class whose only point is to become King

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I could give him the power to attack the king (kinda like butler)

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
what if the King doesn’t die?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Both versions can become a much stronger than normal king. The first born can also trick the unseen/cult as I mentioned and also tank conversations even if they aren’t fooled. The hier can act as an extra vote due to not counting towards the Unseen and cults faction limit.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
But how does it help it’s faction?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The ability’s are ment to make sure that it’s hard to know his faction if and when he steps up. If you don’t like that consept then I won’t be able to convince you.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
This is basically a gum-up class that doesn’t help anyone

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Good. Im going for the heir to be someone who doesn’t know who the unseen is. Also what I have been trying to say is that regardless of if he used his night Ability or not he comes up as unseen/cult on the sidebar for the other members. This would have the same effect on cult because he only ever converts to heir as per what I said next to him.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
Also, if you knew the FB could do that, you would never ever ever whisper to an heir

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
But the Unseen see the other Unseen on the side bar

Also this wouldn’t fool the cult at all

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
To tell the heir who he needs to vote with. Basically you want to prevent him from accidentally voting up unseen or innoing sus BD. Plus once he becomes king it is even more important for them to communicate.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
But why would they whisper them under that circumstance?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Because the heir doesn’t meet with them at night.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
But why would unseen whisper to each other?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
If you are the heir then they want you to know who the evils are so you can vote with them. As the First Born you can use loyalty to get then to whisper to you after a Conversion attempt who the evils are. You could then out them.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Then, if he isn’t there at night, how does it fool them?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
I know. Read the class because THIS IS EXPLICITLY AN EXEPTION!

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Erm. You are aware unseen know who unseen are, right?

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The unseen won’t know if the conversion succeeded or not and thus might whisper to him who they are when he isn’t converted.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
Then it Fools no one

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
He’s NEVER there at night!

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Moleland
item.description:
But if he’s not there at night…

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Read the heirs passive! The Unseen/Cult will always be told he was converted. He will never meet with them even if he was actually converted.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

He also fools the unseen/cult. That’s important.

Y-you do realise that converted players show up on the playerlist and in the night room, right?

Because “you converted him” and then seeing that you did not convert him about 15 seconds later renders the ability, which is already situational and practically useless, even more useless that it already was

Read full topic

item.title: [Class suggestion + King idea] First born/Heir (social)
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
It says you are the heir. The heir does not meet with the unseen either so that can’t be used to see if he is converted now.

Read full topic
